issue.title: [Python] Use PYARROW_WITH_HDFS when building wheels, conda packages
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-7518](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-7518). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
This new module is not enabled in the package builds

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-7518?focusedCommentId=17010918) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
I assume this is being tested in GHA?

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-7518?focusedCommentId=17016004) by Krisztian Szucs (kszucs):*
We have a GHA cron job and a crossbow nightly to tests the hdfs integration.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-7518?focusedCommentId=17016106) by Neal Richardson (npr):*
Both GHA cron and crossbow nightly sounds redundant. Given our current state of the art, I think we should prefer crossbow (better reporting, ability to trigger on demand)

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-7518?focusedCommentId=17023129) by Neal Richardson (npr):*
Issue resolved by pull request 6203
